result.execSummary:
The defendant Reaquan D Maniece was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 193 days.
Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats for work and follow-up care treatment. 
No electronic monitoring allowed.
Court advised defendant that if he successfully completes probation, defendant's record to be expunged.

miscConds.notes: The Court ordered restitution in the amount of $19.00 joint/several payable to John DeWitt.

Pay all supervision fees.
Provide DNA sample -  pay surcharge.
Pay all mandatory surcharges, costs, fees and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses).
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Mr. DeWitt.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation department.
Cognitive thinking evaluation, cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms.

records.addlTxt: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charges and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Case adjourned to 12/10/14 @ 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing.

Defendant Reaquan D Maniece in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Reaquan D Maniece in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to: 
COUNT 1:  Misdemeanor Theft pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.50(23)(g) and  COUNT 2:  Disorderly Conduct pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 947.01 and 939.51(3)(b).

Attorney Calvin R. Malone in court, defendant Reaquan D Maniece not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Parties prepared to proceed to trial.  Case remains set for Jury Trial before Branch 21 on 12-08-14 at 9:00 a.m.

Parties advised that any and all motions must be filed in Br. 21 on or before the final pretrial date; hearing to be scheduled at the time of filing.  Motions must be heard prior to trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 09:00 am.
